decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall begin not later than three years from the date of this decision.
Reason: In order to comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990, as amended by Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004.

Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans and specifications: [Unnumbered Location Plan, ASB006 � 01, ASB006 � 02, ASB006 � 03, Description of the linear thermal bridges and Fire Strategy Plan. Received: 04/06/2024
ASB006 � 07. Received: 16/07/2024 
ASB006 � 04A. Received: 25/07/2024
Design & Access Statement and Improvement measures analysis. Received: 29/07/2024
Description of materials and building elements, Energy Demand, Energy consumption, Production summary and Building envelope. Received: 20/09/2024
ASB006 � 05A, ASB006 � 06, ASB006 � 07, Energy Statement, Solar thermal collector document, Energy generated by solar panels calculations, Energy generated by the installation calculations and Predicted Energy Assessment. Received: 03/10/2024].
Reason: In order to ensure the development is carried out in accordance with the planning permission.

Condition : 3 - The materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the development hereby permitted shall match those used in the existing building, unless otherwise shown on the approved plans.
Reason: In order to safeguard the appearance of the area.

Condition : 4 - Secure covered cycle parking facilities on the first floor of the property must be fully implemented and made available for use before the first occupation of the development or commencement of the approved use as appropriate and thereafter retained for use at all times without obstruction.
Reason: In order to support sustainable transport objectives.

Condition : 5 - Before the development hereby permitted is first occupied or brought into use, the Local Planning Authority shall be informed of the agreed naming and numbering of the proposed dwellings so that arrangements can be put in place to ensure that, with the exception of a person eligible for a disabled person's badge issued pursuant to section 21 of the Chronically Sick and Disabled Persons Act 1970 (or similar legislation), no resident of the development shall obtain a resident's parking permit. Any occupiers of the approved development shall surrender any such permit wrongly issued or held.
Reason: In order to protect the free flow and safety of traffic on nearby highways and to support sustainable transport objectives.

Condition : 6 - The occupiers of the hereby approved flats shall be notified about refuse and recycling store and collection as shown on approved plans and refuse strategy. The grit bins shall be made available for use before the development hereby permitted is first occupied, and shall be retained thereafter for such use at all times without obstruction.
Reason: In order to ensure adequate provision for waste and recycling and protect the amenity of area.

Condition : 7 - No residents of the development shall obtain a resident's parking permit within any controlled parking zone which may be in force in the area at any time.
Reason: To support sustainable transport objectives in accordance with adopted local plan policy EC2.
description: Change of use from a flat to HMO for no more than seven person with the erection of a second floor rear extension and roof extension to form an additional storey.
